definition: to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan
Han, one of the Seven Hero States of the Warring States 戰國七雄|战国七雄/Korea from the fall of the Joseon dynasty in 1897/Korea, esp. South Korea 大韓民國|大韩民国/surname Han

pinyin: Zhong1 Ri4 Han2 tong3 yi1 biao3 yi4 wen2 zi4

sentences.english: The 2nd trilateral meeting was held in Beijing in 2009.
sentences.chinese: 第二次中日韓領導人會議2009年在北京舉行。

sentences.english: The leaders of ASEAN, China, Japan and Korea issued the Kuala Lumpur Declaration.
sentences.chinese: 東盟和中日韓領導人在會上發表了《吉隆坡宣言》。

sentences.english: For CJK Unified Ideographs blocks, browse by radical.
sentences.chinese: 對於中日韓統一表意文字塊，瀏覽激進。

sentences.english: The three foreign ministers deiced to hold the fifth trilateral foreign ministers' meeting in Japan next year.
sentences.chinese: 三國外長決定明年在日本舉行第五次中日韓外長會議。

sentences.english: The cooperation among China, Japan and ROK complies with the trend of times and therefore has a bright prospect.
sentences.chinese: 中日韓合作順應時代潮流，大有可爲。

sentences.english: The meeting this past weekend of Japan, Korea, and China showing, again, cooperation in East Asia.
sentences.chinese: 上週末代中日韓會議再次展現了東亞的合作。

sentences.english: In 2010, trilateral cooperation continued to enjoy steady development.
sentences.chinese: 2010年，中日韓合作繼續穩步發展。

sentences.english: In response, Lee Myung-bak expressed congratulation on the complete success of the second trilateral leaders' meeting.
sentences.chinese: 李明博祝賀第二次中日韓領導人會議取得圓滿成功。
進一步加強了中日韓合作。

sentences.english: China-Japan-ROK cooperation is an important part of East Asian cooperation.
sentences.chinese: 中日韓合作是東亞合作的重要組成部分。

sentences.english: The three leaders expressed the willingness of furthering the economic and trade cooperation among their countries.
sentences.chinese: 三國領導人表示將共同推進中日韓之間的經貿合作。

sentences.english: The meeting agreed that the fourth trilateral summit of the three nations will be held in Japan next year.
sentences.chinese: 會議同意，第四次中日韓領導人會議明年在日本舉行。

definition: the original name of 孫中山|孙中山[Sun1 Zhong1 shan1], Dr Sun Yat-sen (1866-1925), first president of the Republic of China and co-founder of the Guomintang 國民黨|国民党[Guo2 min2 dang3]
a guild/(in olden times) an association such as a political party, religious group or trade guild/the Japanese word for company
